SENT.plain: Authors report a case of a 35-year-old male with right-sided mild paresis, incontinence, dysexecutive syndrome, short-term memory loss and behavioral changes

Bilateral cerebral infarcts in the region of the caudate nuclei and the adjacent white matter were proved by brain MRI and multiple stenoses of the branches of Willis-circle were confirmed by MR angiography
Elevated protein level and pleocytosis were found in the cerebrospinal fluid with intrathecal IgG synthesis
Serum rapid plasma reagin, Treponema pallidum Particle Agglutination test, Treponema pallidum ELISA, liquor Venereal Disease Research Laboratory tests were positive
24M U/day intravenous penicillin-G treatment was given for 14 days
The patient has vascular dementia due to the bilateral strategic infarcts disconnecting the prefrontal circuits; his symptoms are similar to general paresis
Laboratory and radiologic improvement was observed
Still, the patient have severe residual cognitive decline
